intro: Midweek briefing: company moves and product decisions led the cycle. It leans builder-first, with concrete things to test quickly. We reviewed 25+ sources so you do not have to.

briefing.title: Testing ads in ChatGPT
briefing.note: OpenAI begins testing ads in ChatGPT to support free access, with clear labeling, answer independence, strong privacy protections, and user. Why it matters: It reflects competitive and product direction shifts in AI.

briefing.title: LangSmith is Now Available in Google Cloud Marketplace
briefing.note: Today, we're thrilled to announce that LangSmith, the agent engineering platform from LangChain, is available in Google Cloud Marketplace. Why it matters: It may improve developer velocity or reduce integration overhead.

lead_story.title: Uncertainty-Aware Multimodal Emotion Recognition through Dirichlet Parameterization
lead_story.what_happened: In this work, we present a lightweight and privacy-preserving Multimodal Emotion Recognition (MER) framework designed for deployment on edge devices.
lead_story.our_take: Research read: To demonstrate framework's versatility, our implementation uses three modalities - speech, text and facial imagery.
lead_story.what_to_do: Read method and evaluation sections, then compare claims with prior baselines.

articles.title: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio 2026 – Working Without Agent Skills
articles.summary: I recently ran an experiment using GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio 2026 to see whether it could generate repetitive code based on a custom coding convention . The goal was simple: Can Copilot adopt a predefined boilerplate template and reuse it across projects?
articles.what_happened: The author recently ran an experiment using GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio 2026 to see whether it could generate repetitive code based on a custom coding convention .
articles.why_it_matters: The goal was simple: Can Copilot adopt a predefined boilerplate template and reuse it across projects?
articles.what_to_do: Reuse one implementation step in your stack and document what changed.
articles.our_take: Builder read: The goal was simple: Can Copilot adopt a predefined boilerplate template and reuse it across projects?

articles.title: Uncertainty-Aware Multimodal Emotion Recognition through Dirichlet Parameterization
articles.authors: Remi Grzeczkowicz, Eric Soriano, Ali Janati et al.
articles.summary: In this work, we present a lightweight and privacy-preserving Multimodal Emotion Recognition (MER) framework designed for deployment on edge devices. To demonstrate framework's versatility, our implementation uses three modalities - speech, text and facial imagery.
articles.what_happened: In this work, we present a lightweight and privacy-preserving Multimodal Emotion Recognition (MER) framework designed for deployment on edge devices.
articles.why_it_matters: To demonstrate framework's versatility, our implementation uses three modalities - speech, text and facial imagery.
articles.what_to_do: Read method and evaluation sections, then compare claims with prior baselines.
articles.our_take: Research read: To demonstrate framework's versatility, our implementation uses three modalities - speech, text and facial imagery.

articles.title: PABU: Progress-Aware Belief Update for Efficient LLM Agents
articles.authors: Haitao Jiang, Lin Ge, Hengrui Cai et al.
articles.summary: Large Language Model (LLM) agents commonly condition actions on full action-observation histories, which introduce task-irrelevant information that easily leads to redundant actions and higher inference cost.
articles.what_happened: Large Language Model (LLM) agents commonly condition actions on full action-observation histories, which introduce task-irrelevant information that easily leads to redundant.
articles.why_it_matters: It indicates where research momentum and performance gains are moving.
articles.what_to_do: Read method and evaluation sections, then compare claims with prior baselines.
articles.our_take: Method signal: It indicates where research momentum and performance gains are moving.
